tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
Starfish is an aquatic animal because it spends its entire life in water. Also it has characteristics adapted for living in water.
 
Elephant and Bear are not aquatic animals. They are terrestrial animals.

overallFeedback.feedback: Well done ! It is the correct answer.

questions:
1) *Frog* is an amphibian.
(Dog / Frog / Dolphin)

2) *Shark* has fins for swimming.
(Shark / Duck / Frog)

3) Aquatic animals have *streamlined* body.
(masculine / streamlined / light)

4) *Gills* are adapted to absorb oxygen dissolved in water.
(Lungs / Blowhole / Gills)

metadata.title: Q4- Fill in the best answers from the given alternatives.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
Fishes have fins which help them to swim easily in water. It does not help in absorbing dissolved oxygen.

answers.text: Helps to absorb oxygen dissolved in water.

overallFeedback.feedback: Good work ! It is the correct answer.

params.question: What is the function of the given part of these aquatic animals?

metadata.title: Q7- What is the function of the given part of these aquatic animals?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Click on the information hotspots to know more about the adaptational characteristics of the given aquatic animals.
Webbed-feet helps aquatic animals to swim easily and faster in water.

Frogs' skin is critical to their survival. Through it, they both drink and breathe. Frogs don't swallow water; they get all the moisture they need through their skin. And though frogs have lungs, they rely on the extra oxygen they absorb through their skin, especially when they're underwater.
Fishes have streamlined body so that it can reduce friction in water and thus helping the fishes to move easily.

Whales and dolphins are mammals and breathe air into their lungs, just like we do. They breathe through nostrils, called a blowhole, located right on top of their heads. This allows them to take breaths by exposing just the top of their heads to the air while they are swimming or resting under the water.
The kingfishers have long, dagger-like beaks. The beak is usually longer and more compressed in species that hunt fish, and shorter and more broad in species that hunt prey off the ground.

Gills are organs located on the side of fish heads that have many small blood vessels called capillaries. As the fish opens its mouth, water runs over the gills, and blood in the capillaries picks up oxygen that's dissolved in the water.
Fish scales primarily serve two purposes: protection and locomotion. It protects the fish from predators and It helps them to reduce water resistance while swimming.
